text.footnote: documented as of this encounter (statuses as of 10/05/2023)
documented as of this encounter (statuses as of 10/05/2023)

content.content:
Formatting of this note is different from the original.
Patient ID: Bob G Bilek is a 53 y.o. male.
Primary Care Provider: Matthew Newton, DO
Chief Complaint: Follow-up of the Right Knee
HPI
Onset: fell off a ladder on 9/15/2020
Context: work injury
Location: anterior
Severity: Mild
Associated symptoms: Weakness and Stiffness
Alleviating factors: rest
Aggravating factors: ROM, squatting, kneeling, and working
Prior Injections: cortisone injection Dec 2021 with minimal relief
Prior surgery: Right open patellar tendon repair and removal of tibial tubercle ossicle on 09/21/2020.
Prior x-rays: OAK
Prior MRI: Prime Dec 2021
Work related: yes
Current work status: full duty
Bob has continued stiffness and mild anterior pain. Symptoms are worse with prolonged work days. No new injuries. Prior cortisone injection
He has had continued low grade symptoms since surgery that relate to his original injury.
The following portions of the patient’s history were reviewed and updated as appropriate: allergies, current medication review, family history, social history and surgical history.
PHYSICAL EXAM:
Surgical incisions which are well healed. There is no erythema, no fluctuance, no drainage, no signs of infection.
Tenderness of the medial joint line and patella
ROM
Flexion: 120
Extension: 0
*Crepitus with ROM
No ligamentous laxity
+ patellar grind test.
Quad strength: 5/5
Hamstring strength: 5/5
Distally the patient is neurovascularly intact. Normal pulse exam with 2+ distal pulses. Rapid cap refill.
ASSESSMENT:
Unilateral primary osteoarthritis of right knee
Pain in right knee
Tear of medial meniscus of knee <Right side; Subsequent>
s/p right knee open patellar tendon repair and removal of tibial tubercle ossicle. DOS 09/21/2020
- continued knee pain and stiffness since returning to work
PLAN:
There are no physical exam signs concerning for infection at this time
We will continue with the post operative rehabilitation protocol as instructed
WBAT
Patient may take tylenol as directed: up to two 500mg tabs every 8 hours, not to exceed 3000mg daily. Advised not to do this if there are any liver problems. We also discussed otc ibuprofen as directed: two 200mg tabs every 6 hours as needed, not to exceed 2400mg daily. Advised not to take this if any kidney problems, if the patient is on blood thinners, or gastric issues.
Working full duty
Cortisone injection Dec 2021 with only little relief
Submit for visco injections
Discussed daily biking to hopefully improve stiffness
His pain doesn't seem to be related to the known MMT that was also present immediately after work injury but treated non-operatively therefore I'd recommend continuing conservative treatment and no scope at this time.
Follow up - when visco approved
Patient and wife are agreeable to plan. All questions answered.
Patient was seen and evaluated by physician assistant, Taylor Atkinson PA-C. The physician assistant was acting as sole provider.
VISIT ORDERS:
Orders Placed This Encounter
ORT PRIOR AUTH
XR KNEE 4 VIEWS RIGHT
Electronically signed by Taylor at 09/24/2022 9:22 AM CDT

item.caption: XR KNEE 4 VIEWS RIGHT - Final result (08/11/2022 2:04 PM CDT)

paragraph.content: No fx or dislocation. Post op changes of patellar s/p patellar tendon
repair. Mild PF DJD. Medial and lateral joint space well maintained.
Unilateral primary osteoarthritis of right knee
Tear of medial meniscus of knee <Right side; Subsequent>
